hu.kazocsaba.math.matrix

Interface SubmatrixAccessor2

  • All Superinterfaces:
    SubmatrixAccessor
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ImmutableSubmatrixViewAccessor2

    public interface SubmatrixAccessor2
extends SubmatrixAccessor
    Provides strongly typed access to submatrices of a 2x2 matrix. The exact semantics of the accessor methods depend on the implementation.
    Author:
    Kaz√≥ Csaba

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Vector2 column(int index)
      Returns an entire column.
      Vector2 row(int index)
      Returns an entire row.

      • Methods inherited from interface hu.kazocsaba.math.matrix.SubmatrixAccessor

        matrix, matrix2, matrix3, rowVector, rowVector2, rowVector3, rowVector4, vector, vector2, vector3, vector4

    • Method Detail

      • row

        Vector2 row(int index)
        Description copied from interface: SubmatrixAccessor
        Returns an entire row. This function selects the elements between (row, 0) and (row, c-1) where c is the number of columns in this matrix, but returns these elements as a column vector.
        Specified by:
        row in interface SubmatrixAccessor
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the row
        Returns:
        IllegalArgumentException if row is not a valid row index

      • column

        Vector2 column(int index)
        Description copied from interface: SubmatrixAccessor
        Returns an entire column. This function selects the elements between (0, col) and (r-1, col) where r is the number of rows in this matrix.
        Specified by:
        column in interface SubmatrixAccessor
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the column
        Returns:
        IllegalArgumentException if col is not a valid column index
